p: In addition to the DALYs resulting from HAT, AAT also has substantial impacts on human health by reducing the supply of meat and milk, as well as animal draft power for crop production. These losses affect not only human nutrition but also the agricultural incomes that allow access to education and healthcare [ 4]. A study in 1999 indicated that the annual economic losses from meat and milk production alone were c. US$1 billion at current prices [ 5].
